How to Install install-mimic on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • install-mimic

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install install-mimic on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing install-mimic on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall install-mimic in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install install-mimic, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install install-mimic Using apt

To install install-mimic in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install install-mimic using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install install-mimic

The installation of install-mimic might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install install-mimic Using apt-get

To install install-mimic using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install install-mimic.

sudo apt-get -y install install-mimic

Install install-mimic Using Synaptic

To install install-mimic using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install install-mimic on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for install-mimic. This will display the install-mimic package in the package window, now to install install-mimic, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the install-mimic package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of install-mimic.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install install-mimic Using aptitude

To install install-mimic on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of install-mimic.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install install-mimic using the command aptitude install install-mimic.

sudo aptitude -y install install-mimic

How to Upgrade install-mimic on debian

If you want to upgrade the install-mimic package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade install-mimic using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade install-mimic to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade install-mimic.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade install-mimic sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade install-mimic

Upgrade install-mimic using Aptitude

To upgrade install-mimic using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade install-mimic.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade install-mimic

Upgrade install-mimic using Synaptic

To upgrade install-mimic using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for install-mimic, now right-click install-mimic, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade install-mimic just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall install-mimic on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall install-mimic from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just install-mimic, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove install-mimic

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of install-mimic

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of install-mimic you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge install-mimic

Remove install-mimic using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall install-mimic using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for install-mimic, right-click the install-mimic package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall install-mimic click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install install-mimic on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade install-mimic using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of install-mimic then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
